text: I have started a new position as an Assistant Professor in the University of Washington Information School. Come say hi!

I successfully defended my dissertation, 'The Atomization of Vulnerability: An Ethnographic Investigation of Quantification and Automation in Philadelphia’s Homeless Services Coordinated Entry System.' Many thanks to my wonderful committee :)
Ben Zhang and I presented a paper at AoIR, on Waiting and the technopolitics of AI
I was invited to a fantastic panel on Ethnographic Stories in Information Science at ASIS&T. Many thanks to Kaitlin Montague for the invitation!
New paper accepted at CSCW 2024, 'Intermediation: Algorithmic Prioritization in Practice in Homeless Services'
I presented part of my dissertation work, a paper on 'Intermediation', at 4S in Amsterdam

New paper accepted in Big Data & Society, 'Reparations of the Horse?: Algorithmic Reparations and Overspecialized Remedies'. My co-authors and I present a new framework for classifying and repairing algorithmic harms
New paper out in Big Data & Society 'After automation: Homelessness prioritization algorithms and the future of care labor'
I'll be interning with the Government Accountability Office in DC this Spring!
I presented a paper, 'Toward a Theory of Low Tech Algorithms,' at the 4S (Society for the Social Studies of Science) annual meeting
I was accepted to the ASIS&T Doctoral Colloquium in London—it was great meeting so many other cool doctoral researchers!
I presented at the AERI (Archival Education and Research Institute) 2023 meeting at LSU
Our paper 'Recordkeeping, logistics, and translation: a study of homeless services systems as infrastructure' was published in Archival Science!
I presented a paper at the 4S (Society for the Social Studies of Science) annual meeting in Cholula, Mexico! I was on an excellent panel 'Social Care', chaired by Cian O'Donovan.
I participated in the Algorithmic Reparation Workshop organized by Dr. Apryl Williams and Dr. Jenny Davis. It was fantastic!
Dr. Garcia and I have been selected for a Google Award for Inclusion Research grant, supporting my ongoing dissertation research!
I passed my field prelims and am now a candidate!
I've been accepted as a 2022 LEADING fellow! I'll be working with Dr. Synatra Smith at Temple University's Scholars Studio
Alexandria Rayburn and I presented our research on social workers' use of Reddit at ASIST 2021
I chaired the panel 'Theorizing Care and the Digital' at SLSA 2021, and presented on my ongoing research into the infrastructures of homeless services
I'm excited to join the Center for Ethics, Society, and Computing as an affiliate researcher
